mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter Regarding Sale of Civil War Era Steel Engravings
mdRecord.dcterms:description: A letter written by Mrs. Maude L. Howard of Floyd Co. on February 21, 1939 to Mr. G.H. Mathewson. She tells him that she is sending another lot of envelopes and stamps with steel engravings "for inspection if you wish to buy." He responds that she may send engravings with prices so he may select what he wishes to buy. The price for the "first Lot" is typed as .50, and the "last" is 1.50 for a total of $2.00 payed to Maude L. Howard for previous engravings sold.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Antiques
Steel engravings
Civil War
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University. University Libraries
